interestingFact: Tokyo’s Shibuya Crossing is the busiest pedestrian intersection on earth.
Over half of the Amazon rainforest, the planet’s largest biodiversity hotspot, sits within Brazil.
Canada has the world’s longest coastline, stretching over 202,000 km.
Nigeria is home to more than 520 living languages, making it Africa’s most linguistically diverse country.
Including overseas territories, France spans 12 time zones—the most of any country.
Russia stretches across 11 time zones (reduced to 9 in 2011) and remains the world’s largest country by area.
Australia is the only continent without any active volcanoes.
The Ganges–Brahmaputra Delta in Bangladesh is the largest river delta on the planet.
Egypt’s Great Pyramid of Giza is the only surviving structure of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
More than half of all lemur species in the world are found only on the island of Madagascar.
